subject: Re: for mike E. and other new people
author: Misty
full_text:
Bruce 

Perhaps it is just that you had such difficulty using other methods. 
I remember when we were helping you using other methods evpmaker and 
the sweep method and then you got your first box. I think over time 
we all developed our contact field and the communication becomes 
stronger. Again method doesnt matter its the intent and the 
dedication that helps us get better communication going with the 
other side. 

The boxes are an exciting tool, unfortunately not everyone can hear 
them live, same goes for the other methods not everyone can hear what 
comes thru. Once the connection is made and they speak freely and we 
can hear them better, then the options are endless =)

For most when starting out theres a period of time to train the ears 
to hear them. It would be nice if we could all skip that part of the 
drill. Either way once you start making connection and you have 
trained your ears, your results can improve.

Misty

> I agree with some of what Bruce said. But dont go throwing out

matter what method you are using you are building a bridge of 
contact. I get alot of the same voices coming thru no matter what 
method I use. There are many ways they can manipulate sound whether 
its using evpmaker, the boxes, water, laser, spiricom, etc.As for it 
being the only live method that is not quite true either some of the 
other methods allow you to hear some of the feedback you get live too 
(if you can hear them).The basic rule of thumb is to remember there 
are no experts. Try it and see what works best for you and your own 
hearing.Misty--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday 
<paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:>> > mike,> > I'm sorry I was not 
around when you started, I guess no one took the time to explain 
boxes and box research to you.> Well here is a crash course!> > I 
don't know what your experience is with evp_itc or any other form of 
spirit communication, but whatever you have learned about capturing 
and analyzing traditional EVP, has to be thrown right out the window. 
> Box research is a horse of a whole different color. The basic 
premise for traditional evp capture is that the spirit or entity that 
is grounded or in visitation at a set location, will manipulate the 
ambient energy available to it that surrounds the recording medium, 
be it a digital or analog recorder. It uses this energy, usually 
thought to be EMF energy to place an asimally of a voice onto the 
recorder. The recording is then uploaded to a computer and is gone 
over by the researcher/investigator to search for these little 
whispered voices on the recording. This traditional way of gathering 
spirit communication serves it's purpose or at least has served it's 
purpose. > > When you decided to pick up a box, everything you ever 
learned about spirit communication ceased to apply. Box communication 
in a nutshell, no matter what type of box you use is run on the same 
premise. The box or radio is made to sweep the dial fast enough so 
that no stable or whole radio signal is captured. The signal is 
therefore fragmented into small bits of sound and fragments of human 
speech. The idea is for our spirit friends to be able to manipulate 
the fragments of sound to form intelligible words, phrases and 
messages that we can understand clearly.> > As you know the major 
factor in the difference between box research and traditional EVP is 
the fact that you can and most certainly do hear spirit communication 
through a box live and in real time.> That's what sets this apart 
from any other paranormal communication research in the world or even 
the history of paranormal research.> > The research you are embarking 
on now will take time and patience to become accustomed too but 
eventually with experience comes stronger communication, a better 
relationship between you and your spirit tech/guides and a better ear 
for hearing and discerning spirit communication from ordinary radio 
noise.> > this is just a quick explanation but don't worry anyone 
here that knows me can tell you there will be much more to come.> > 
The reason I started this reply was your reference to class a EVP, in 
box research there is no such thing, you either hear it or you 
don't.> > Mike my ears and my mouth are always open so any questions, 
don't hesitate.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@:
